snippet: The play “Farragut North,” better known by its screen adaptation, “The Ides of March,” involving a spin doctor for a major presidential candidate, is at the Zella Fry Theater in Union.
abstract: Michael Sommers reviews Beau Willimon play Farragut North, directed by Michael Barakiva and starring Philip Mills, at the Zella Fry Theater (Metropolitan/New Jersey).
lead_paragraph: The play “Farragut North,” better known by its screen adaptation, “The Ides of March,” involving a spin doctor for a major presidential candidate, is at the Zella Fry Theater in Union.

headline.seo: A Review of ‘Farragut North,’ at the Zella Fry Theater
headline.main: For a Slick Operator, One Spin Too Many
headline.print_headline: For a Slick Operator, One Spin Too Many
